page.title: 18THE PEOPLE OF AYMESTREY
page.content: As this is a rural area about half the population are farmers or in some way connected with agriculture. These are mainly 'local' families often interrelated. Some of the rest have employment in towns up to 30 mls away but a large proportion have 'retired' from many walks of life and so provide a good balance of interests and skills. This all blends together very well to give a very self supportive community. As the Village School closed years ago the younger school age children are catered for in schools at Wigmore (4mls) and Leominster. College education is provided at Ludlow and Hereford. During the Summer months the population is increased by visitors renting the holiday cottages some who return year after year.
